# Question

You are given a list of events where each event is a tuple with a start and a finish time (in the format 'YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM'). Write a function `event_scheduler` that checks for any scheduling conflicts among the events. The function should return "No conflicts" if there are no overlapping events and "Conflict" if any events overlap in time. If the list is empty, return "No events". Use package Dates for parsing.

```julia
using Dates

function event_scheduler(events::Vector{Tuple{String, String}})
    if isempty(events)
        return "No events"
    end
    
    event_ranges = [Pair(parse(DateTime, start), parse(DateTime, finish)) for (start, finish) in events]
    sorted_events = sort(event_ranges, by=first)
    
    for i in 1:length(sorted_events)-1
        if sorted_events[i].second > sorted_events[i+1].first
            return "Conflict"
        end
    end
    return "No conflicts"
end
```

The above Julia code has been executed with the following results:

```plaintext
Execution has been successful (no errors detected). Consider adding 1-2 challenging unit tests to improve the main function - use `@test` macro, organize them in `@testset begin .. end` block.
```

```julia
using Test
using Dates

function event_scheduler(events::Vector{Tuple{String, String}})
    if isempty(events)
        return "No events"
    end
    
    event_ranges = [Pair(parse(DateTime, start), parse(DateTime, finish)) for (start, finish) in events]
    sorted_events = sort(event_ranges, by=first)
    
    for i in 1:length(sorted_events)-1
        if sorted_events[i].second > sorted_events[i+1].first
            return "Conflict"
        end
    end
    return "No conflicts"
end

@testset begin
    @test event_scheduler([]) == "No events"
    @test event_scheduler([("2022-10-10 10:00", "2022-10-10 11:00")]) == "No conflicts"
    @test event_scheduler([("2022-10-10 10:00", "2022-10-10 11:00"), ("2022-10-10 10:30", "2022-10-10 11:30")]) == "Conflict"
    @test event_scheduler([("2022-10-10 10:00", "2022-10-10 11:00"), ("2022-10-10 11:00", "2022-10-10 12:00")]) == "No conflicts"
end
```

```julia
using Test
using Dates

function event_scheduler(events::Vector{Tuple{String, String}})
    if isempty(events)
        return "No events"
    end
    
    event_ranges = [Pair(parse(DateTime, start), parse(DateTime, finish)) for (start, finish) in events]
    sorted_events = sort(event_ranges, by=first)
    
    for i in 1:length(sorted_events)-1
        if sorted_events[i].second > sorted_events[i+1].first
            return "Conflict"
        end
    end
    return "No conflicts"
end

@testset begin
    @test event_scheduler(Vector{Tuple{String, String}}([])) == "No events"
    @test event_scheduler([( "2022-10-10 10:00", "2022-10-10 10:30")]) == "No conflicts"
    @test event_scheduler([( "2022-10-10 10:00", "2022-10-10 11:00"), ("2022-10-10 10:30", "2022-10-10 11:30")]) == "Conflict"
    @test event_scheduler([( "2022-10-10 10:00", "2022-10-10 11:00"), ("2022-10-10 11:00", "2022-10-10 12:00")]) == "No conflicts"
end
```

```julia
using Test
using Dates

function event_scheduler(events::Vector{Tuple{String, String}})
    if isempty(events)
        return "No events"
    end
    
    event_ranges = [Pair(parse(DateTime, start, "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM"), parse(DateTime, finish, "YYYY-MM-DD HH:MM")) for (start, finish) in events]
    sorted_events = sort(event_ranges, by=first)
    
    for i in 1:length(sorted_events)-1
        if sorted_events[i].second > sorted_events[i+1].first
            return "Conflict"
        end
    end
    return "No conflicts"
end

@testset begin
    @test event_scheduler([]) == "No events"
    @test event_scheduler([("2022-10-10 10:00", "2022-10-10 10:30")]) == "No conflicts"
    @test event_scheduler([("2022-10-10 10:00", "2022-10-10 11:00"), ("2022-10-10 10:30", "2022-10-10 11:30")]) == "Conflict"
    @test event_scheduler([("2022-10-10 10:00", "2022-10-10 11:00"), ("2022-10-10 11:00", "2022-10-10 12:00")]) == "No conflicts"
end
```

Here's the improved implementation:

```julia
using Test
using Dates

function event_scheduler(events::Vector{Tuple{String, String}})
    if isempty(events)
        return "No events"
    end

    sorted_events = sort([(parse(DateTime, start, "yyyy-mm-dd HH:MM"), parse(DateTime, finish, "yyyy-mm-dd HH:MM")) for (start, finish) in events])
    
    for i in 1:length(sorted_events)-1
        if sorted_events[i][2] > sorted_events[i+1][1]
            return "Conflict"
        end
    end
    return "No conflicts"
end

@testset begin
    @test event_scheduler(Vector{Tuple{String, String}}([])) == "No events"
    @test event_scheduler([( "2022-10-10 10:00", "2022-10-10 10:30")]) == "No conflicts"
    @test event_scheduler([( "2022-10-10 10:00", "2022-10-10 11:00"), ("2022-10-10 10:30", "2022-10-10 11:30")]) == "Conflict"
    @test event_scheduler([( "2022-10-10 10:00", "2022-10-10 11:00"), ("2022-10-10 11:00", "2022-10-10 12:00")]) == "No conflicts"
end
```
